hero.title: Urban horticulture meets thoughtful software
hero.subtitle: Aphylia delivers calm, data-backed tools for balconies, rooftops, and community gardens—pairing horticulture expertise with reliable software.

story.title: From Aphyllante to Aphylia
story.subtitle: Two friends who cared for balconies and servers in equal measure.

spark.title: Mediterranean beginnings
spark.description: Teenage summers near Montpellier taught us how Aphyllante survives drought—and how much design lives inside a garden.

dare.title: Prototype marathon
dare.description: We spent three straight nights on the first version: Mango Monster cans, instant noodles, and a Spotify queue that lost its mind—but the MVP shipped.

momentum.title: Care over chaos
momentum.description: We swapped all-nighters for better rituals, kept the coffee + crossed-fingers build prayer, and focused on making planting data effortless for others.

quote.text: One plants rows of seedlings, the other plants rows of digits. Together we plant excuses for people to eat better.

pillars.title: How we build Aphylia
pillars.subtitle: Inspired by analog gardens, delivered with the calm polish of dependable software.

story.title: From art school experiments to Aphylia
description: 2020—2024 · We met in a Montpellier art school building 3D worlds and beautiful environments.
Five fell deep into systems and computers while Xavier became the neighborhood plant whisperer; we shared our obsessions daily.
2025 · Motivated to build together, we created Aphylia—Xavier sketches the rituals, Five codes the calm garden OS we wished existed.

nameOrigin.title: Why the name?
nameOrigin.description: “Aphylia” references Aphyllante, the Mediterranean plant that lines the Montpellier paths where this project sprouted.

definition.title: Montpellier roots, browser branches
paragraphs: Aphylia is the love letter to Aphyllante, the plant that lined the paths of our hometown and basically dared us to care harder about biodiversity.
We make an encyclopedic playground for anyone flirting with urban gardens, food sovereignty, and nerdy plant lore—complete with jokes, rituals, and fewer spreadsheets.
Beyond data, we give you garden planners, watering forecasts, and compatibility notes so your balcony ecosystem is as well-orchestrated as your playlists.
definition.helper: TL;DR: we translate gardening chaos into approachable, nerd-approved guidance.

offerings.title: What we offer right now
offerings.subtitle: Bits of the platform already delighting testers (with plenty more sprouting soon).

encyclopedia.title: A plant encyclopedia that actually answers questions
encyclopedia.description: Every entry reads like a mentor texting you back with actionable steps, not lorem ipsum.

monthly.title: A comfy discovery interface
monthly.description: Monthly spotlights, lore drops, and swipeable cards that feel like that old UI everyone keeps asking about.

gardenPlanner.title: Garden builder + watering brain
gardenPlanner.description: Sketch gardens with plants you own or dream about, then let Aphylia schedule watering and care.

photoId.title: Photo recognition
photoId.description: Snap, upload, and let the app tell you whether that's basil, mint, or a very confident weed.

swap.title: Plant swaps between neighbors
swap.description: Trade cuttings, surplus tomatoes, and stories without a marketplace headache.

seeds.title: Seed shop with heart
seeds.description: Curated seeds and starter kits delivered with zero gatekeeping energy.

services.title: Aphylia's features
services.subtitle: A quick snapshot of live Aphylia capabilities.
items: Guided plant encyclopedia entries with reminders you can trust
Garden planner that syncs layouts, care notes, and microclimate logs
Swipe discovery that mixes seeds, swaps, and rituals without the noise
Real-time task nudges that react to weather and microclimate data
Shareable garden links for friends, family, or community spaces

community.title: Dream feature: Community Tab
community.description: We want a space where neighbours swap cuttings, post watering wins, and organise seed drives—right inside Aphylia.
community.helper: If that lights you up, ping us. Every "yes" nudges it higher on the roadmap.

feedback.title: Built with your emails
feedback.subtitle: We live for voice notes, sketches, and "hear me out" paragraphs.
list: Feature requests get answered faster than our plants drink espresso water.
We screenshot beta feedback and tape it above the desk until it's shipped.
Lau (FIVE's partner) shaped half the onboarding experience with late-night brainstorms.
feedback.lauCredit: Have an idea? Lau taught us to listen before we code.

meet.title: Meet the team
meet.subtitle: Two friends, one plant-shaped friendship bracelet.

xavier.name: Xavier
xavier.description: Keeps a notebook of balcony microclimates, paints UI ideas in watercolor, and never travels without pruning shears.
xavier.ritual: Coffee in one hand, cigarette in the other, whispering to seedlings before every deploy.
xavier.placeholder: Photo placeholder — Xavier in the balcony jungle

five.name: FIVE
five.description: Writes migration scripts at midnight, labels every plant by Latin name, and can debug while watering basil.
five.ritual: Mango Monster, a whispered prayer, fingers crossed as the build bar crawls across the screen.
five.placeholder: Photo placeholder — FIVE guarding the terminal

practical.title: Practical info
practical.description: HQ address reveal is on the way—we're busy choosing which plant guards the entrance.
practical.address: Official address: dropping soon (the lease ink is drying).

collaboration.title: Collaboration welcome
collaboration.description: We're all ears for partnerships that spread knowledge, boost biodiversity awareness, or simply add more jokes to the onboarding screens.

cta.title: Ready to plant something legendary?
cta.subtitle: Browse the encyclopedia, plan your dream garden, or tell us what feature to ship next.
